intro: Oldenlandia multiglomerulata var. linearifolia, commonly known as the linear-leaved spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic foliage. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
